intro: Clarisia urophylla, commonly known as the white-flowered clarisia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its long, slender stems and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly waxy texture. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and pleasant fragrance.
